observations: Output grid contains only the non-zero values present in the input grid.
Output grid has a much smaller size than input grid.
The non-zero values in the input grid form distinct clusters or groups.
The output grid preserves the relative spatial arrangement of the clusters in the input.
The output grid's rows represent groups/clusters of non-zero values from top to bottom in the input.
Input grid always has the dimensions 11x11.
Output grid size varies across the training examples.
hypotheses: The output grid contains only clusters of non-zero values from the input, ordered by their topmost row.
Output is constructed by extracting the smallest bounding box around each set of contiguous non-zero cells and arranging them from top to bottom of input.
selected_rule: The output grid contains only clusters of non-zero values from the input, ordered by their topmost row.
step_plan: Identify all non-zero clusters in the input grid.
Determine the minimum bounding box encompassing each cluster.
Order the clusters by their topmost row position in the input grid.
Construct the output grid by placing the bounding boxes of the clusters in the identified order.
